alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Madison River Valley; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:10PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, southeastern Beaverhead and south central Gallatin Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms centered around a line extending from near Ennis to near Raynolds Pass. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Yellowstone, Sheridan, Virginia City, Ennis, Alder, Big Sky, Mcallister, Lakeview, Yellowstone Village, Laurin, Cameron, Raynolds Pass, Jeffers and Red Rock Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
